struct impl

Detailed Description

Base class for all win32gui (and your) window classes.

Every window that exists on screen provides (at least) this functionality.

Member Function Documentation

void egui::window_top::wait_for ( const egui::ev::base &  to_wait_for  ) 

waits for a certain event to be sent to this window Example:

w->wait_for( ev::destroy() );

void egui::window_top::set_timer ( int  event_id,
unsigned  elapse 
)

Sets a timer for this window. At the elapse millisecs, this window will receive the timer event, with the id set to event_id.

void egui::window_top::kill_timer ( int  event_id  ) 

Kills the timer having this ID.

void egui::window_top::bring_to_top (  ) 

Brings this window to top of the Z order.

wnd egui::window_top::child_from_point ( point  pnt  )  const

Returns the child at the given point, or null if there's no child at that point.
The point is in client coordinates relative to your window.

void egui::window_top::flash ( bool  invert  ) 

Flashes the window - one time.
If invert is true, it will show the window "flashed". If invert is false, it will show the window normally.

To implement flashing (multiple times), you should implement a timer, and repeatidly call flash.

void egui::window_top::do_redraw (  ) 

Forces a window to be redrawn

void egui::window_top::set_foreground (  ) 

Activates this window (but not if your application is in the background). This window must be created by your thread.

template<class event_type>
void egui::window_top::send_event ( const event_type &  evt  )  [inline]

sends an event to this window. The event must derive from new_event<> class.

template<class window, class holder, class event>
static void egui::window_top::register_event_handler ( event_handler< event > holder::*  data  )  [inline, static]

Registers an event handler for a custom event class (one that derives from new_event<>).

template<class handler>
static void egui::window_top::add_non_intrusive_handler ( const handler &  h  )  [inline, static]

adds a non-intrusive event handler.
